author: nordbjerg
content: Re EIP-2935, am I understanding correctly that even though the account is empty (balance 0, nonce 0, no code) it should be inserted into the database and be part of state root calc?

author: ralexstokes
content: that‚Äôs the idea, SSTORE, SLOAD the data

author: tersec
content: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/tree/v1.5.0-alpha.0/tests/formats/operations states that there should be a `<input-name>.ssz_snappy` for each test, but https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tree/v1.5.0-alpha.0/tests/minimal/electra/operations/consolidation/pyspec_tests/multiple_consolidations_below_churn https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tree/v1.5.0-alpha.0/tests/minimal/electra/operations/consolidation/pyspec_tests/multiple_consolidations_equal_churn https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tree/v1.5.0-alpha.0/tests/minimal/electra/operations/consolidation/pyspec_tests/multiple_consolidations_equal_twice_churn etc only have `pre`/`post` states?

author: hsiaowei
content: The test vector is wrong (missing operation). I will fix it. Thank you for reporting it!

author: bridge-bot
content: <holiman> > <holiman>  It would be touch-deleted later tho.. ? (re @amphora_interop_bot: <nordbjerg> Re EIP-2935, am I understanding correctly that even though the account is empty (balance 0, nonce 0, no code) it should be inserted into the database and be part of state root calc?)

author: nordbjerg
content:
let me rephrase

the account is empty according to EIP-161 (no code, zero nonce, zero balance), so according to that EIP the account should not exist. is the account in EIP-2935 exempt from this?

author: nordbjerg
content: this

author: bridge-bot
content: <holiman> That would make zero sense (special-casing it like that). Better to give it a nonce or 1-wei balance and let the rules remain, imo

author: lightclient
content: It wasn't defined explicitly before, but in 7002 the withdrawal requests should appear in the requests lists in the same order they are dequeued (h/t <@508125616940515329> . I made a PR adding this text to the spec: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8502

author: jochembrouwer
content: Would it make sense to add an `id` field to the withdrawal request encoding? It is now assumed that the list which gets outputted from the EVM for the operations is now in the "right order" for the withdrawals. If an `id` field is added this is made more explicit (but of course leads to more bandwith, and this also does not feel necessary) ü§î

author: jochembrouwer
content: I would be able to sort an arbitrary array with withdrawals in it, however I cannot be sure that the withdrawals operations are in the right order given an arbitrary list ü§î

author: jochembrouwer
content: In EIP 6110 is the Request Type `0x00` (so 1 zero-byte) or `0x` (no bytes)?

author: marioevz
content: A single zero byte

author: marioevz
content: Otherwise RLP encoding could mess up the identification of the type

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yep I assumed so, thanks üôÇ

content: Ah yeah good point about the RLP encoding
